title: Add Funsor (`Constant`) that is constant wrt to input variables
body:
Sometimes it is useful to keep track of certain Funsor inputs even though the underlying Funsor is constant wrt to those inputs. Examples are Zero terms in [`Delta.eager_reduce`](https://github.com/pyro-ppl/funsor/blob/e66bc6f6b5bc19d51e163666090bf22f6c0255d7/funsor/delta.py#L189) and In [`contrib.funsor.TraceEnum_ELBO`](https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/blob/45d6516170c865c28ceae6133f3f2f3b30c77b6f/pyro/contrib/funsor/infer/traceenum_elbo.py#L223). This is currently implemented as expanded Tensor terms which is memory/computation inefficient and only allows `Bint` input type. Proposed `Constant` funsor has following benefits: 

1. Declare constant inputs of a Funsor in a memory efficient way: e.g. `Constant(cost.inputs, Number(0))`
2. Allow variables with `Real` output type: e.g. `Constant(OrderedDict(x=Bint[3], y=Real), Number(0))`
3. Define computationally efficient patterns for `subs/reduce/unary/binary` operations
4. Convert to and from `ProvenanceTensor` (#543) where provenance of the tensor corresponds to `const_inputs`. Edit: I donâ€™t think this is correct, the counterpart of `ProvenanceTensor` should something similar to `Delta`.

```py
# Substitution

# 0(x, y)
a = Constant(OrderedDict(x=Bint[3], y=Real), Number(0))
# 0(x=0, y) = 0(y)
assert a(x=0) is Constant(OrderedDict(y=Real), Number(0))
# 0(x=0, y=3.14) = 0
assert a(x=0, y=3.14) is Number(0)

# Binary ops

# 1(x, y)
a = Constant(OrderedDict(x=Bint[3], y=Real), Number(1))
# b(x)
b = Tensor(...)["x"]
# 1(x, y) *  b(x) = (1 * b(x))(y) = b(x)(y)
c = a * b  # returns Constant(OrderedDict(y=Real), b*Number(1))

# Reduction

# 1(x, y)
a = Constant(OrderedDict(x=Bint[3], y=Real), Number(1))
# 1(x=0, y) + 1(x=1, y) + 1(x=2, y) = 3(y)
a.reduce(ops.add, "x")  # returns Constant(OrderedDict(y=Real), Number(3))
```

The argument in `Constant(const_inputs, arg)` doesn't have to be a `Number`. It can be any Funsor with the condition that `const_inputs` and `arg.inputs` have to be disjoint.

The main motivation is to use `Constant` as a wrapper for `ProvenanceTensor` and as targets for `log_measures` in a general version of `contrib.fusor.Trace_ELBO` (https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/2893).
